sect2.title: The File Manager
sect2.para: The user interface of Nautilus, the GNOME file manager, has undergone a significant overhaul since the release of GNOME 2.0 to make it easier to use and more powerfully integrated with the rest of the desktop and applications.:

sect3.title: Context menu plug-ins
sect3.para: Context-sensitive menus can now link Nautilus to functions performed by other applications. In this illustration, Fileroller, our new archive-handling application, has added a menu items when you right-click on an archive.

sect3.title: Property tab plug-ins.
sect3.para: The Nautilus ile properties dialog now shows custom tabs for special file formats, such as images or media files. For instance, you can see the dimensions of a graphic file, or information about ogg or MP3 audio files.

sect3.title: Improved Preferences dialog
sect3.para: The new Nautilus preferences dialog illustrates the GNOME design philosophy: clean, simple and usable..

sect3.title: Multi-head support
sect3.para: Like the rest of GNOME 2.2, Nautilus is now multi-head aware. For instance, if you launch an application from a particular screen, it will now appear on that screen.

sect2.title: Startup Notification
sect2.para: GNOME can now show that an application is starting, so you don't feel the need to click a second time. For instance, the cursor may change to a clock while the application starts.
